main event: Two separate sightings of disc-shaped objects in Willcox, Arizona, in 1954. Both witnesses reported seeing shiny, disc-shaped objects with brief observations of a few seconds each.
interesting points: Both sightings reported the objects as disc-shaped and shiny, with a brief observation time of 2-3 seconds and a similar estimated size of around 25-50 ft in diameter.
The first witness described the object as smooth, silvery, and assumed a horizontal position before the reflection was lost.
The second witness reported the object appearing stationary, and estimated its diameter to be about 25 ft with a thickness of 8 to 10 ft.
Both witnesses were driving at the time of the sightings and were alone, with no other witnesses to corroborate the observations.
The reports were sent to the Technical Intelligence Center at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base in Dayton, Ohio for analysis.
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
